title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
fmancinelli left at 00:07 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds jvdrean left at 00:19 (Quit: Leaving. MartinCleaver joined #xwiki at 00:42 MartinCleaver left at 01:02 (Quit: MartinCleaver bblfish left at 01:48 (Quit: Leaving. bblfish joined #xwiki at 01:49 bblfish left at 01:54 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds lucaa left at 02:00 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds nickless left at 02:11 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds sdumitriu left at 04:16 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:14 venkatesh left at 06:15 (Client Quit venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:15 phancox left at 06:34 (Quit: Leaving. phancox joined #xwiki at 07:27 mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:27 phancox left at 07:59 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:32 phancox joined #xwiki at 08:42 silviar joined #xwiki at 08:43 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 08:44 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:05 arkub joined #xwiki at 09:16 lpereira joined #xwiki at 09:22 asrfel left at 09:34 (Quit: Leaving. jvdrean left at 09:38 (Quit: Leaving. silviar left at 09:42 (Quit: Leaving. asrfel joined #xwiki at 09:43 lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:44 vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:50 silviar joined #xwiki at 09:54 silviar1 joined #xwiki at 09:56 silviar left at 10:00 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds vmassol - (10:14): gooood mooooornnnniiiiing team vmassol - (10:14): mflorea: any status on the office preview integration for 2.5M2? :) fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:14 mflorea - (10:16): vmassol: :( I haven't started. I had to work on server side image resizing for Ludovic. I hope to start asap vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 10:18 vmassol left at 10:19 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds lucaa left at 10:20 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds fmancinelli left at 10:20 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:22 lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:23 ztane - (10:25): does anyone know, why my international links fail with mod\_proxy\_ajp + tomcat & URIEncoding="UTF-8", seems that XWiki still decodes UTF-8 "ä" as 2 latin1 chars and converts them to "??" ztane - (10:25): \*internationalized sburjan joined #xwiki at 10:32 sburjan left #xwiki at 10:32 florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:34 sburjan joined #xwiki at 10:36 bblfish joined #xwiki at 10:36 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:38 jvdrean1 joined #xwiki at 10:38 jvdrean left at 10:38 (Read error: Connection reset by peer flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 10:39 vmassol1 - (10:54): tmortagne: regarding PlainTextRenderer, I see we're using a link serializer, the pb is that the link serializer depends on the wiki syntax…. so we need to decide what we want to do tmortagne - (10:57): vmassol1: LinkReferenceSerializer did not have anything to do with xwiki syntax tmortagne - (10:58): it's supposed to be just to serialize a Link object tmortagne - (10:58): i have to go, back in 1h i hope vmassol1 - (10:58): yes but that depends on the syntax vmassol1 - (10:58): ex: vmassol1 - (10:58): example: vmassol1 - (10:58): something@interwiki vmassol1 - (10:58): vs vmassol1 - (10:58): interwiki:interwiki:something phancox left at 11:00 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 11:02 nickless joined #xwiki at 11:24 cjdelisle - (11:28): Good morning, anyone have an opinion re: [proposal] Add xcontext.dropPermissions() function to take away all programming/script author permissions when called.? cjdelisle - (11:28): I have the patch and I'd like to commit before I forget about it. sburjan\_ left at 11:32 (Remote host closed the connection sburjan - (11:34): guys .. it seems that the logo image (XWiki logo) breaks on toucan skin .. it is not displayed sburjan - (11:37): the problem that the path to the image is /xwiki/skins/Toucan/logo.PNG instead of /xwiki/skins/toucan/logo.PNG sburjan - (11:37): can someone fix this ? mflorea left at 11:38 (Quit: Leaving. nickless is now known as abusenius ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) vmassol1 - (11:42): sburjan: do we have a jira issue for this? If so it should be set 2.5M2 for fixing it since it's a regression and is thus a blocker vmassol1 - (11:42): I think I was a mail this morning about someone having this problem but I'm not sure vmassol1 - (11:43): in any case we need someone to look at this indeed before 2.5M2 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:43 sburjan - (11:43): okay. I'll file a JIRA issue sburjan - (11:43): but can you confirm ? vmassol1 - (11:44): no time sorry, I'm in a meeting vmassol1 - (11:44): but if you have the problem on a clean install then no need to confirm sburjan - (11:44): I have it on M1 clean vmassol1 - (11:45): you should check on the latest snapshot vmassol1 - (11:45): always evalica joined #xwiki at 11:45 vmassol1 - (11:45): since things might have been fixed in the meantime sburjan - (11:45): yes, but I am updating the documentation sburjan - (11:47): nop. this is another type of bug. When switching the skins from COlibri to Toucan and vice-versa, the path to the logo gets modified (don't know how and why) sburjan - (11:47): so this is a geneeral skins problem, not just toucan flaviusolaru left at 11:51 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds silviar1 left at 12:05 (Quit: Leaving. abusenius left at 12:13 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds npm\_ joined #xwiki at 12:37 npm left at 12:38 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds bblfish - (12:39): hello bblfish - (12:40): did you get the email I sent to the list on the DNS problem? cjdelisle - (12:40): I saw it. vmassol1 - (12:40): bblfish: yes, I forwarded it to the xwiki SAS infra team but no answer yet bblfish - (12:41): essentially it means that myxwiki is not available from some places mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:41 cjdelisle - (12:43): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/CryptographicModule <-- might be able to use functions from this to generate certs. cjdelisle - (12:44): bblfish - (12:47): can't see anything there cjdelisle - (12:48): $services.crypto.x509.certsFromSpkac() bblfish - (12:49): ah got the page this time cjdelisle - (12:49): it returns an array but array[0] should do what you want. bblfish - (12:52): looks like you have left out all the pieces to do with WebID sburjan left at 13:06 (Quit: Leaving. cjdelisle - (13:14): The url should be included in the cert. cjdelisle - (13:15): It doesn't say FOAFSSL in the cert because it's a generic client cert generator. cjdelisle - (13:16): / FOAFSSL compatibility. cjdelisle - (13:16): final GeneralNames subjectAltNames = cjdelisle - (13:16): new GeneralNames(new GeneralName(GeneralName.uniformResourceIdentifier, webId)); cjdelisle - (13:16): certGenerator.addExtension(X509Extensions.SubjectAlternativeName, true, subjectAltNames); cjdelisle - (13:17): ( http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-crypto/src/main/java/org/xwiki/crypto/x509/internal/X509Keymaker.java ) silviar joined #xwiki at 13:29 sburjan joined #xwiki at 13:30 kwoot joined #xwiki at 13:31 kwoot - (13:32): Hi all. Simple question: how can I make a textblok with multiple lines within a table cell when I use the "|" as a separator? cjdelisle - (13:37): You could try {{html wiki=true}} then your table and use
. Someone more experienced with the rendering engine might have a better way. asrfel left at 13:37 (Quit: Leaving. asrfel joined #xwiki at 13:38 cjdelisle - (13:39): If you are not concerned where the line breaks, the browser will break long lines into multiple lines, you can use css to customize how that works. kwoot - (13:39): Thanks cjdelisle. I'll give it a try. silviar - (13:41): Hi kwoot. Should be enough to write something like this: silviar - (13:41): |This is some text silviar - (13:41): On multiple lines | silviar - (13:41): The 2 line text would appear in the first cell on 2 lines in the example above silviar - (13:45): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Test/25Snapshots/testtable.png cjdelisle - (13:45): indeed that works, must remember to try the obvious things before assuming a problem is difficult ;) silviar - (13:49): And even easier would be to insert the table using the wysiwyg editor and just pasting the text bloc inside the cell :) venkatesh left at 13:51 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds tmortagne - (13:53): cjdelisle: note on
you don't need to use html to force line break, you have \\ syntax for this abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:54 cjdelisle - (13:54): Ah thanks, eventually I will have to read Rendering beginning to end if I'm ever to know all of these tricks. venkatesh joined #xwiki at 14:03 sburjan - (14:06): guys sburjan - (14:16): is anyone on 2.5M1 and on Windows ? sburjan - (14:17): I think I found a blocker bug vmassol1 - (14:27): mflorea: ping mflorea - (14:27): vmassol: pong mflorea - (14:28): vmassol1: pong vmassol1 - (14:28): mflorea: question for you. If I modify the syntax for links in HTML comments, does it impact the wysiwyg code? vmassol1 - (14:28): basically we now have 2 xwiki syntaxes: 2.0 and 2.1 vmassol1 - (14:28): and I'd like to use xwiki syntax 2.1 for html comments for links vmassol1 - (14:28): is it transparent for you? mflorea - (14:30): it should be transparent, I'm extracting the string reference from the comment and send it to the server (i.e. rendering module) to parse it and give me the targeted entity (e.g. document) mflorea - (14:30): but let me check vmassol1 - (14:30): ok thanks mflorea - (14:40): I'm taking the string after "startwikilink:" and sent it to the server for parsing. I'm looking just if this string starts with "mailto:" or "attach:" to be able to know what dialog to display. If you're not going to change this then the editor will still work vmassol1 - (14:41): ok thanks. I won't change this but you'll now be able to get that info from Link.getType() in the future mflorea - (14:43): yes, but to get Link.getType() I have to send the reference to the server first. Currently the type of link is computed before parsing the link reference (mainly from the CSS class of the wrapping span). vmassol1 - (14:49): ok kwoot left at 14:50 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds tmortagne - (14:54): guys could I have some vote about component-observation ? sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 15:02 MartinCleaver joined #xwiki at 15:05 venkatesh left at 15:19 (Remote host closed the connection arkub left at 15:32 (Quit: Leaving penyaskito joined #xwiki at 15:56 asrfel left at 16:11 (Quit: Leaving. silviar left at 16:25 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan left #xwiki at 16:43 lpereira left at 17:06 (Quit: Leaving. abusenius left at 17:16 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds mflorea - (17:17): guys, I get a lot of "Deleted: svn:mergeinfo" in my diffs when I merge from trunk to 2.4 branch. Do you have this too? mflorea - (17:18): this didn't happen before, i.e. with other branches vmassol1 - (17:21): I think we changed the svn version on the server side to 1.6 vmassol1 - (17:21): (I might be wrong) vmassol1 - (17:21): maybe you have some oldish client? mflorea - (17:22): the problem is that the diff is pretty big although I touch just two files.. DrPoO joined #xwiki at 17:35 DrPoO - (17:35): Hi, I have 2 questions that I have not been able to find answers to: 1) How do change the default xWiki logo. 2)How do I delete a space? cjdelisle - (17:37): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins <-- shows how to change the logo. cjdelisle - (17:38): You don't have to create a new skin, just edit the global.vm template in /templates/ cjdelisle - (17:39): Or make your own logo and put it in skins/colibri/logo.png cjdelisle - (17:40): Deleting a space is just deleting all documents in that space. DrPoO - (17:40): I have deleted all of the documents in a space but it still appears but with a "?" icon right next to it cjdelisle - (17:41): Which space? There are probably hidden documents. tmortagne - (17:41): mflorea: i have the same issue since 1.6 upgrade tmortagne - (17:41): no idea why mflorea - (17:42): thanks, at least I know it's not something on my side tmortagne - (17:42): i have the issue with subversive i did not tried with svn command line client tmortagne - (17:42): did you ? cjdelisle - (17:42): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/DehiddenifierSnippet <-- unhide all hidden documents. mflorea - (17:44): I use svn from command line vmassol1 - (17:44): tmortagne: your skype is offline mflorea - (17:44): this time a checkout xwiki-web-2.4 from command line and then merged also from command line tmortagne - (17:45): vmassol1: raa it's dead again, restarting it tmortagne - (17:46): it get stuck at least once a day now sburjan` left at 17:46 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds sburjan` joined #xwiki at 17:46 sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 17:53 sburjan` left at 17:54 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds sburjan\_ is now known as sburjan` ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) venkatesh joined #xwiki at 17:57 DrPoO - (18:09): So any other suggestions regarding how to delete an empty space? vmassol1 - (18:10): DragosRusu: a space cannot be empty :) vmassol1 - (18:10): a space is defined by the fact that there's at least one document in it vmassol1 - (18:10): if you're talking about the blog space it's because we have the notion of hidden documents vmassol1 - (18:10): we have a script to remove them DrPoO - (18:10): so how do i make hidden documents visible? vmassol1 - (18:11): DrPoO: see http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/DeleteSpaceSnippet vmassol1 - (18:11): check version 2 cjdelisle - (18:11): Why are we still releasing with hidden documents? vmassol1 - (18:12): cjdelisle: why not? vmassol1 - (18:12): :) cjdelisle - (18:12): They cause a lot of people problems. vmassol1 - (18:12): we need to fix the way we handle hidden docs for sure but nobody has worked on it afaik vmassol1 - (18:12): (sergiu said he wanted to work on it some time ago though) vmassol1 - (18:13): ideally what we want is the notion of nested space but it's not there yet so hidden docs was our workaround but it's been implemented in a bad manner vmassol1 - (18:13): whoever wants to fix this is welcome :) vmassol1 - (18:13): s/welcome/most welcome/ cjdelisle - (18:13): IMO the architecture is not designed to allow documents to be hidden so it's impossible to make any security guarantees. vmassol1 - (18:13): hidden is not about security vmassol1 - (18:13): but about visibility cjdelisle - (18:14): Nested spaces sound much better. Huge job if done "right" though. vmassol1 - (18:14): require the new model vmassol1 - (18:14): (to be done right) cjdelisle - (18:15): I imagine a single entity type for wiki, space, document, object, nested object, property. cjdelisle - (18:16): Then nested spaces and nested objects are handles at once. bblfish - (18:24): je peux plus acceder a myxwiki bblfish - (18:24): non a webid.myxwiki.org bblfish - (18:24): ah ca marche maintenant bblfish - (18:25): Apparament vous n'avez toujours pas de Authoritative Name Server bblfish - (18:25): oop bblfish - (18:25): s bblfish - (18:25): Apparently you don't have an authoritative nameserver, which may be causing the problem Enygma` left at 18:27 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds cjdelisle - (18:36): There's one really awesome advantage to requiring XWikiContext everywhere. I have a couple holes in the api but I can't exploit them because you need to context to do just about anything. lpereira joined #xwiki at 18:39 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 18:39 florinciu left at 18:40 (Quit: Leaving. lucaa left at 18:43 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds sburjan` - (18:50): ping sburjan` - (18:50): quote sburjan` - (18:50): I would -love- a wiki which would/could integrate with something like nagios, or even run specific commands on the machine it's hosted on as a page is pulled (eg. nmap) sburjan` - (18:50): do we support this ? cjdelisle - (18:51): lol nmap lucaa joined #xwiki at 18:52 cjdelisle - (18:52): You can spawn a new process in groovy. sburjan` - (18:52): :D cjdelisle - (18:52): check java.lang.Runtime sburjan` - (18:52): I'm doing some PR :) Enygma` left at 18:54 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan` - (18:55): and how's the migration from mediawiki ? sburjan` - (18:56): Sorinello, the only thing I'd want to do that mediawiki can not do itself is integrate, at some level, something like nagios sburjan` - (18:56): to generate inline/active diagrams, network maps, and the like. mflorea left at 18:57 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (18:58): guys i still need some votes for the xwiki-core-component-observation thing, i can't install an extension which want to listen to events without that cjdelisle - (19:05): Would it work to have a project for all types of events? evalica left at 19:06 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol1 left at 19:12 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (19:12): cjdelisle: that would be wrong tmortagne - (19:13): there is not a limited knowed list of events tmortagne - (19:13): anyone can come with its own event tmortagne - (19:14): so mixing document related event with component events would be very bad IMO, it would make this project depends on lot's of APIs you probably don't care cjdelisle - (19:14): Well we have a few types in the core, I was thinking a project for "events" seemed easier to look at than a project which exists only as a workaround for maven limitations. tmortagne - (19:15): i don't want to depends on model API in a project where all I want is to receive event when a new component is registered tmortagne - (19:15): also it's not a maven thing tmortagne - (19:16): you would have the same issue with anything cjdelisle - (19:16): I thought the issue was cyclic dependency. tmortagne - (19:16): yes tmortagne - (19:16): but cyclic dependency is not just maven tmortagne - (19:16): you have too project that depends on each other it's an issue whatever the system cjdelisle - (19:17): Maven blocks it (I think that's good) to try to keep the dependency graph looking like a tree. tmortagne - (19:17): you need to build one of the project before another tmortagne - (19:17): maven or not cjdelisle - (19:17): Good point. cjdelisle - (19:18): You have my +1 just as soon as I can understand how this is not a workaround. tmortagne - (19:18): (what was a crappy workaround was to put the components related event in the implementation project) cjdelisle - (19:19): Of course you can't very well put them in the api section because of the same dependency problem. Correct? tmortagne - (19:19): yep tmortagne - (19:20): I even tested it before I see it :) cjdelisle - (19:21): xwiki-core-component-observation would have nothing other than events? tmortagne - (19:21): for now no i don't see anything else tmortagne - (19:22): actually wait i think i made a mistake in my second mail tmortagne - (19:24): i tough ComponentEventManager was part of ComponentManager but actually it seems not so i would move this too tmortagne - (19:24): ha no it is tmortagne - (19:24): ... tmortagne - (19:25): too late for my eyes :) cjdelisle - (19:25): Moving them in to observation-api? (I assume you found a problem with this idea) tmortagne - (19:25): should be a implementation detail what is the ObservationManager used in ComponentManager but it's part of the public API... cjdelisle - (19:26): (Aside from the fact that it's not really the scope of observation.) tmortagne - (19:26): cjdelisle: i did not even though of that since it's not in the scope of observation ;) cjdelisle - (19:27): I guess +1 because it's "the worst option except for all the rest". cjdelisle - (19:28): mail sent tmortagne - (19:29): i agree that this is not very nice to have a that small project but i can't find a better option tmortagne - (19:30): maybe latter we will find other thing to put it it, who knows ;) cjdelisle - (19:31): My thinking is more about trying to avoid cyclic dependencies (or tricks to make de facto cyclic dependencies) if you never have a cyclic dependency then maintainence is so much easier. bblfish left at 19:32 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (19:32): sure cjdelisle - (19:32): hmm. new security issue. bblfish joined #xwiki at 19:33 bblfish left at 19:37 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds abusenius joined #xwiki at 19:37 cjdelisle - (19:40): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5497 tmortagne left at 19:58 (Quit: Leaving. bblfish joined #xwiki at 20:24 abusenius - (20:27): evalica found a strange login bypass some time ago which is probably related cjdelisle - (20:30): "The Linux kernel has been purged of a bug that gave root access to untrusted users – again. cjdelisle - (20:30): The vulnerability in a component of the operating system that translates values from 64 bits to 32 bits (and vice versa) was fixed once before – in 2007 with the release of version 2.6.22.7. But several months later, developers inadvertently rolled back the change" haha oops cjdelisle - (20:30): http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/09/15/linux\_kernel\_regression\_bug/ abusenius - (20:32): nice... cjdelisle - (20:35): Demanding the XWikiContext everywhere was surprisingly effective. Everytime I find a hole and I try to attack it, need the XWikiContext. cjdelisle - (20:35): It's like a permission token. npm\_ is now known as npm ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) jvdrean joined #xwiki at 20:36 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 20:36 jvdrean1 left at 20:37 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds lucaa left at 20:38 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds fmancinelli left at 20:38 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds jvdrean left at 20:39 (Client Quit cjdelisle - (20:45): I heard that there's a problem with a script which ships in freebsd and allows the user to run sed as root. cjdelisle - (20:45): It runs sed then replaces the original file with the new one. lucaa1 left at 20:47 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds DrPoO - (21:34): How do I execute a code snippet such as http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/DeletedDocumentsSnippet Proshot joined #xwiki at 21:42 Proshot - (21:43): hy everybody i just installed xwiki, i was wondering with a default installation what is the administrator username and password combo abusenius left at 21:44 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds nickless joined #xwiki at 21:44 sdumitriu - (21:59): Hi Proshot Proshot - (22:00): hy sdumitriu - (22:00): Username: Admin sdumitriu - (22:00): Password: admin Proshot - (22:01): cool let me try this Denis left at 22:03 (Quit: Leaving. bblfish left #xwiki at 22:39 bblfish joined #xwiki at 23:20 bblfish - (23:20): hello bblfish - (23:20): is there no more http://restlet.org ? sdumitriu - (23:34): Not working for me either sdumitriu - (23:35): http://downforeveryoneorjustme.com/http://restlet.org/ bblfish left at 23:35 (Quit: Leaving. bblfish joined #xwiki at 23:36 bblfish left at 23:40 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds lpereira left at 23:58 (Quit: Leaving.
